thread.title: Ravens reportedly will sign ex-Chargers running back Danny Woodhead
thread.title_full: Ravens reportedly will sign ex-Chargers running back Danny Woodhead

title: Ravens reportedly will sign ex-Chargers running back Danny Woodhead
text:
Mar 8, 2017 at 10:46p ET 0Shares 
The Baltimore Ravens are looking to address their lackluster running game and hope Danny Woodhead will be the answer. The Ravens will sign the veteran running back when free agency officially begins Thursday, NFL Network reported Wednesday. Source: The #Ravens are signing former #Chargers RB Danny Woodhead. He’s fully healthy after ACL surgery in 2016. Big pickup. 
— Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) March 9, 2017 
Woodhead’s season was cut short last year after suffering an ACL injury in Week 2. The 32-year-old spent the past four years in San Diego, where he was a threat coming out of the backfield. 
In 2015, he had 80 catches for 755 yards and six touchdowns in the passing game. The Ravens could use a boost at running back after finishing 28th in the league in rushing yards last season. 
Woodhead, who will be joining his fourth team, first made a name for himself with the Patriots, spending two-plus years in New England.
